content.question: Which of the following best describes the most likely effect of the formation of a triplex <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> structure (Figure 3) on the synthesis of the frataxin protein?

choices.label: The binding of the ribosome to the <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is prevented, resulting in a decrease in frataxin translation.
The <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will not degrade in the cytoplasm, leading to an increase in frataxin translation.

<math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase is prevented from binding to the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in a decrease in frataxin <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> transcription.
The protein will include extra amino acids, resulting in a protein with an altered secondary structure.

content.answer: <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase is prevented from binding to the <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in a decrease in frataxin <math alttext="m R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> transcription.
